comment info:
I notice that there is a big difference in what young people from various countries think is the most important factor for success. In some countries like the U.S. and Germany, hard work is seen as the key factor, while in others like Japan and Nigeria, education is considered more important. Also, family wealth or connections are more valued in countries like Lebanon and Morocco.
I wonder why there are such different opinions among young people in different countries. Are these opinions influenced by the quality of education in those countries, the job market, or cultural values? Also, how do these factors affect their actual success in life?
In my community, I think hard work and education are both seen as important. Most people believe that working hard in school and getting a good education will lead to success. Family connections also play a role, but they are not seen as the main factor. This mix of opinions might be why we focus on both studying hard and gaining practical work experience.

I notice how a countries social and economic circumstances influence the opinions of their youths.
